page.title: 12LULWORTH CARNIVAL 1985 (1)
page.content: The first Carnival,to be held so some of the villagers say for nearly 50 years,took place on June 30th 1985. The Procession,comprising 9 floats began at the School,passed through West Lulworth and down to the field near the Cove, in front of the Coast_ guard Cottages.Here there were several stalls and sideshows that included; skittles,a greasy pole and the roast_ of a pig. During the afternoon there were two excellent displays.The first was by the Christchurch Youth Marching Band and the second,by the Puddletown Majorettes. The Carnival Queen was Miss Sarah Hallett and her attendant Princesses were Karen Firmstone,Laura Symes and Kelly Waters.Their float was decorated with beautiful roses.They also had the hard task of judging the Fancy Dress.
